content.prompt: Which of the following best explains the changes in the phenotype frequencies of the stickleback population in Loberg Lake?

choices.label: Predation in the marine environment is different from predation in Loberg Lake.
Marine predators and sticklebacks both colonized Loberg Lake.
Sticklebacks with the partial armor-plate phenotype have the highest rate of reproduction and survival.
The population of sticklebacks in Loberg Lake is subject to genetic drift.

skill.text: 5.D: Use data to evaluate a hypothesis or prediction, including rejecting or failing to reject the null hypothesis.
